subject: Management
title: Performance Conversations
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Performance Conversations.

hook.text: A manager avoided telling a struggling employee for so long that termination became the only option left.

buildup.text: Performance conversations are hard. That's why most managers delay them until it's too late.

discovery.text: Early intervention gives people a chance. Late intervention takes that chance away.

twist.text: The conversation you're avoiding is the one that could save someone's career, not end it.

climax.text: Be direct, specific, and supportive. Here's what I see, here's the gap, here's how I'll help.

punchline.text: The kindest thing is the honest conversation, delivered early.

quiz.question: Why should performance conversations happen early?
options: Early conversations give people a chance to improve before it's too late
Waiting longer makes the conversation easier for the manager
Performance problems always resolve themselves over time
